titlegrp.title: Synthesis and structure of a perpendicular bridging alkylidyneamine ligand in [W2(η-C5H4Pri)2Cl4(µ-Cl)(µ-EtCNH)]

abstract.p: Treatment of the W___ENT___W triply-bonded dimers [W2(η-C5H4R)2Cl4](R = Pri or Me) with R′CN (R′= Me, Et, or Ph) followed by HCl gas affords the complexes [W2(η-C5H4R)2Cl4(µ-Cl)(µ-R′CNH)] in quantitative yield; the X-ray crystal structure for R = Pri, R′= Et reveals a perpendicular bridging EtCNH ligand.

section.p: J. CHEM. SOC. CHEM. COMMUN. 1991 Synthesis and Structure of a Perpendicular Bridging Alkylidyneamine Ligand in [W2(q-C5H4Pri)2C14( @I)( p-EtCNH)] Qian Feng,a Montserrat Ferrer,a Malcolm L. H. Green,*a Patrick C. McGowan,a Philip Mountforda and Victor S. B. Mtetwab a Inorganic Chemistry Laboratory South Parks Road Oxford OX1 3QR UK b University of Swaziland P/B 4 Kwaluseni Manzini Swaziland Treatment of the WsW triply-bonded dimers [W2(q-C5H4R)2C14] = Pri or Me) with R’CN (R’ = Me Et or Ph) (R followed by HCI gas affords the complexes [W~(~-CF,H,R)~CI~(~-CI)(~-CI)(~-R’CNH)] in quantitative yield; the X-ray crystal structure for R = Pri R’ = Et reveals a perpendicular bridging EtCNH ligand. Alkyne complexes of the general types 1-111 (X= C)are well perpendicular bridge p-alkylidyneamine complexes (I,X = N) established in organo-transition metal chemistry.

However have not been described. Here we report the synthesis and although the closely-related alkylidyneamine ligand (RCNR’) characterisation of the perpendicular bridge p-alkylidyne- has been found to coordinate to metal centres in terminal2 (11 amine derivatives [W2(q-C5H4R)2C1~(p-C1)(p-R’CNH)] (R = X = N) and parallel bridging3 (111 X = N) modes Pri or Me; R’ = Me Et or Ph). J. CHEM. SOC. CHEM. COMMUN. 1991 Treatment of toluene solutions of the W=W triply-bonded compounds [W2(q-C5H4R)2C14] (1 R = Pri a or Me b)4with nitriles (R'CN) affords brown compounds the analytical and spectroscopic datat for which are consistent with com-pounds containing a p-(a + n)-bound nitrile ligand [W2(q-C5H4R)2Cl4(p-(o+ n)-R'CN}](R' = Me 2 Et 3 or Ph 4; R = Pri a or Me b).

Thus the 1H and 13C NMR spectra of 2-4 show resonances assignable to two diastereotopic q-C5H4R ligands and to a coordinated R'CN ligand. In the 13C NMR spectra the resonances for the internal carbon atoms of the R'CN ligand appear at 6 ca. 240 and possess 183W satellites (where observed) of the proper intensity for a carbon atom bonded to one tungsten atom [11(13C-l83W) ca. 95 Hz; satellite intensity ca. 14% by area]. There is no evidence for a v(CkN) absorption in the IR spectra of 2-4 and since submission of our manuscript we have obtained preliminary results of an X-ray crystal structure determination of 3b that confirm the p-(a + n) mode of coordination of the nitrile ligand illustrated.

Complexes containing a p-(0 + n)-nitrile moiety have been reported previously.5 R R' I II m t Satisfactory analyses have been obtained for all the new compounds except 5a which could only be obtained as an oily solid contaminated by varying quantities of solvent. Selected spectroscopic data IR data cm-1 KBr. IR v(N-H) 3342. 5b IH NMR:' 9.54 (br s lH y-MeCNH) 5.99,5.95,5.50,5.47 (4 X br m 4 X 2H 4 X q-C5H4Me) 3.71 (s 3H y-MeCNH) 2.53 (s 6H q-C5H4Me). 8 1H NMR:b 6.99 5.79 5.74 (3 X virtual q 3 X lH 3 X q-C5H4Pri) 5.67 (2 x overlapping virtual q 2H 2 x q-C5H4Pri) 5.59 (virtual q lH q-C5H4Pri) 5.53 [d of virtual q lH 3J(lH-31P) 7.5 q-C5H4Pri] 4.46 (d of q lH 2J 16.1 3J7.3 CH2Me) 4.36 (virtual q lH q-C5H4Pri) 4.07 (d of q lH 2J 15.1 3J7.3 CH2Me) 3.84 (d of q lH 2J 15.1 3J7.3 CH2Me) 3.39 (d of q lH 2J 16.1 3J 7.3 CH2Me) 2.95(sept,1H,J7.3,CHMe2),2.35(sept,1H,J7.3,CHMe2),1.68[d 9H 2J(lH-3lP) 8.8 PMe3] 1.27 (d 3H J 7.3 CHMe2) 1.21 (overlapping 2 X d and t 9H CHMe2 and CH2Me) 1.10 (t 3H 57.3 CH2Me) 1.00 (d 3H J 7.3 CHMe2).

13C-{lH) NMR? 141.4 [d 2J(13C-31P) 7 y-C2Et2] 138.4 132.6 (2 X CPri) 121.3 [d 2J(13C-31P) 7 y-C2Et2] 106.2 103.3 102.2 98.3 95.6 91.5 89.9 89.6 [8 X CH (q-C5H4Pri)] 31.4 [d 3J(*3C-31P) 7 CH2Me] 29.9 (CH2Me) 28.7 28.2 (2 x CHMe2) 23.1,22.9,22.4 21.6 (4 x CHMez) 18.8 17.7 (2 x CH2Me) 15.7 [d 1J(13C-31P) 28 PMe31. 553 Treatment of toluene solutions of 2-4 with HC1 gas affords the purple complexes [W2(q-C5H4R)2C14( p-Cl)(p-R'CNH)](R' = Me 5 Et 6 or Ph 7; R = Pri a or Me b) in near-quantitative yields.

The molecular structure of [W2(q-C5H4Pri)2C14( p-Cl) (p-EtCNH)] 6a$ as determined by single crystal X-ray diffraction is shown in Fig. 1.The compound 6a consists of two mutually eclipsed W(q- C5H4Pri)C12 fragments linked by bridging C1 and EtCNH groups.$ If the q-C5H4Pri rings are considered to occupy single coordination sites and any metal-metal bond is ignored then 6a may be described as a confacial bioctahedron. The W-W bond length [2.9359(4) A] in 6a is substantially lengthened from that of the precursor [W2(q-C5H4Pri)2C14] [la W=W = 2.3678(6) A] and the C-N bond length [1.405(8) A]is notably lon er than those observed for q2-RCNR' complexes (1.22-1.30 R).2 These observations suggest extensive donation of electron density from the ditungsten centre to vacant n* orbitals of the p-EtCNH ligand in a manner analogous to that proposed to occur for dinuclear p-alkyne complexes (I X = CR').la The solution 1H and 13C NMR data for 5-7 are consistent with the maintenance of structures analogous to that of 661.

Thus the 1H NMR spectra show resonances assignable to a diastereotopic -q-C5H4R ring and to a R'CNH ligand the N-H resonance appearing as a broad signal at 6 ca. 6 (in [2H2]dichloromethane) or 6 ca. 10 (in [2H6]dimethyl sulphox- ide). The 13C NMR spectra also show resonances assignable to q-C5H4R and R' moieties. An additional singlet at 6 ca. 145 laR=Pi IbR=Me R' 7 $ Crystal data for 6a C19H28C15NW2,M = 815A1 crystal size = ca.

0.15 x 0.25 x 0.30 mm monoclinic space group nl/c a = 7.347(1) b = 13.840(2) c = 22.767(4) A p = 94.41(2)" V = 2300.7 A3,2 = 4 D,= 2.354 g cm-3 y(Mo-Ka) = 108.05 cm-1 F(OO0) = 1528 scan mode 0-20 T = 293 K 2 < 28 < 50° total unique data 4044 number of observations [I > 3a(Z)] 3164 number of variables 245 observa- tiondvariables 12.9 Rmerge = 0.041 R = 0.028 R = 0.033 (Chebyshev; parameters 21.4 -16.7 16.2 -0.580). Data were collected on an Enraf-Nonius CAD4-F diffractometer . The structure was solved using Patterson and Fourier syntheses and refined by full-matrix least-squares procedures with anisotropic thermal parameters for all non-hydrogen atoms. Hydrogen atoms attached to C were placed in calculated positions.

Crystallographic calculations were carried out using the CRYSTALS suite of programs7 on a Micro VAX 3800 computer in the Chemical Crystallography Laboratory Oxford. Atomic coordinates bond lengths and angles and thermal parameters have been deposited at the Cambridge Crystallographic Data Centre. See Notice to Authors Issue No. 1. B The N-H atom could not be located from a Fourier difference synthesis but its position may be inferred from the IR and NMR data. Selected bond lengths (A) and angles (") as follows W(l)-W(2) 2.9359(4) W(l)-Cl( 1) 2.462(2) W( 1)-C1(2) 2.454(2) W( l)-Cl( 3) 2.434(2) W( 1)-N( 1) 2.064( 6) W( 1)-C( 1) 2.100(7) W( l)-Cpcent(i) 2.03 W(2)-C1( 3) 2.443(2) W (2)-Cl(4) 2.479(2) W( 2)-C1(5) 2.420( 2) W (2)-N( 1) 2.049( 6) W(2)-C( 1) 2.106(7) W(2)-Cpcent(~) 2.04; W( l)-Cl( 3)-W(2) 74.02( 5) C(2)-C(l)-N(1) 126.6(6) Cpcent(l)-w(1)-W(2) 121* 1 Cpcent(2)-W(2)-W(1) 121.9 where Cpcent(l) and Cpcent(2) refer to the computed q-C5H4Pri centroids for W( 1) and W(2) respectively.

which (where observed) shows 183W satellites of the proper intensity for a carbon atom bonded to two tungsten atoms is assigned to the internal carbon atom of the pR'CNH ligand. A sharp band at ca. 3340 cm-1 in the IR spectra of 5-7 is assigned as v(N-H) ; the isotopomer [W2(q-C5H4Pri)2C14( p-Cl)(p-MeCND)] 5a4 prepared from la and MeCN followed by treatment with DC1 shows a band assignable to v(N-D) at 2486 cm-1.

We have also prepared the related perpendicular bridge p-alkyne complex [W2(q-C5H4Pri)2C13( p-Cl)( p-C2Et2)- (PMe3)] 8 from [W2(q-C5H4Pri)2C14( p-C2Et2)]6 and PMe3. The analytical and spectroscopic data for 8 strongly support a structure analogous to those 5-7. Thus the 1H and 13C NMR spectra of 8 show resonances assignable to two types of J. CHEM. SOC. CHEM. COMMUN. 1991 diastereotopic q-C5H4Pri and Et groups and an additional doublet at 6 1.68 is assigned to a PMe3 ligand. Resonances assignable to the internal carbon atoms of the p-C2Et2 ligand are observed as doublets at 6 141.4 and 121.3 [21(13C-31P) 7 Hz] the low field shift being in the range observed for the internal C atoms of the y-R'CNH ligands in 5-7.

The compounds 5-8 are valence isoelectronic and further highlight the close relationship between the R'CNH and RCCR' ligands. In conclusion we have shown for the first time that the RCNH ligand can coordinate in a perpendicular bridging manner analogous to that well-established for alkynes. We thank the Chinese government C.I.R.I.T. of Generalitat de Catalunya and the D.E.N.I. for support (to Q. F. M. F. and P. C. McG. respectively).
